It was noted that the signatures are no longer necessary to fight fraud and the fraud capabilities have advanced allowing this elimination leading to a faster in-store purchase experience.{{cite web|url=https://www.creditcards.com/credit-card-news/signatures-soon-may-not-be-required.php|title=Mastercard, Discover, AmEx and Visa ditching signatures|publisher=creditcards.com=April 13, 2018|date=November 17, 2017|access-date=April 20, 2018|archive-date=June 20, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180620153256/https://www.creditcards.com/credit-card-news/signatures-soon-may-not-be-required.php|url-status=dead}} Visa was the last of the major credit card issuers to relax the signature requirements. The first to eliminate the signature was MasterCard Inc. followed by Discover Financial Services and American Express Co.{{cite news|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-01-12/visa-nixes-need-for-chip-card-signatures-in-victory-for-Wal-Mart|title=Visa Won't Require Signatures|publisher=Bloomberg.com=January 12, 2018}} ==Sponsorships== ===Olympics and Paralympics=== * Visa has been a worldwide sponsor of the [[Olympic Games]] since 1986 and the [[International Paralympic Committee]] since 2002. Visa is the only card accepted at all Olympic and Paralympic venues. Its current contract with the [[International Olympic Committee]] and [[International Paralympic Committee]] as the exclusive services sponsor will continue through 2032 and 2020 respectively.[http://www.paralympic.org/Media_Centre/News/General_News/2010_03_04_a.html Visa Sponsors Third Paralympic Hall of Fame Induction], [[International Paralympic Committee]] (IPC){{Cite web|url=https://usa.visa.com/about-visa/newsroom/press-releases.releaseId.15776.html|title=Visa Renews Olympic Partnership Through 2032|website=usa.visa.com}} This includes the [[Singapore 2010 Youth Olympic Games]], [[2012 Summer Olympics|London 2012 Olympic Games]], the [[2014 Winter Olympics|Sochi 2014 Olympic Winter Games]], the [[2016 Summer Olympics|Rio de Janeiro 2016 Olympic Games]], the [[2018 Winter Olympics|2018 PyeongChang Olympic Winter Games]], the [[2020 Summer Olympics|Tokyo 2020 Olympic Games]], and [[2022 Winter Olympics|the Beijing 2022 Olympic Winter Games]]. * In 2002, Visa became the first global sponsor of the IPC.[http://www.paralympic.org/Partners/Worldwide_Partners/ Visa Worldwide Partners], [[International Paralympic Committee]] (IPC) Visa extended its partnership with the International Paralympic Committee through 2020,{{Cite web|url=https://www.paralympic.org/news/ipc-and-visa-extend-partnership-until-2020|title=IPC and Visa extend partnership until 2020}} which includes the [[2010 Winter Paralympics|2010 Vancouver Paralympic Winter Games]], the [[2012 Summer Paralympics|2012 London Paralympic Games]], [[2014 Winter Paralympics|2014 Sochi Paralympic Games]], [[2018 Winter Paralympics|2018 Pyeongchang Paralympic Games]], [[2020 Summer Paralympics|2020 Tokyo Paralympic Games]] and [[2022 Winter Paralympics|2022 Beijing Paralympic Games.]] ===Others=== * Visa was the jersey sponsor of [[Argentina's national basketball team]] at the [[2015 FIBA Americas Championship]] in [[Mexico City]].[http://www.americas2015.com/equipos2.asp?t=&team=237&n=Argentina&c=ARG 2015 FIBA Americas Championship - Argentina] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160321075233/http://www.americas2015.com/equipos2.asp?t=&team=237&n=Argentina&c=ARG |date=March 21, 2016 }}, FIBA.com, Retrieved March 14, 2016. * Visa is the shirt sponsor for the [[Argentina national rugby union team]], nicknamed the Pumas. Also, Visa sponsors the [[Copa Libertadores]] and the [[Copa Sudamericana]], the most important [[association football|football]] club tournaments in South America. * Since 1995, Visa has sponsored the U.S. [[National Football League]] (NFL) and a number of NFL teams, including the [[San Francisco 49ers]] whose practice jerseys display the Visa logo.{{cite web|url=http://corporate.visa.com/media-center/press-releases/press975.jsp|title=Newsroom – Visa|website=corporate.visa.com}} Visa's sponsorship of the NFL extended through the 2014 season.[http://www.nysportsjournalism.com/nfl-visa-09-9229/ Visa, NFL Give Credit Where Credit is Due] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100324083617/http://www.nysportsjournalism.com/nfl-visa-09-9229/ |date=March 24, 2010 }}, NYSportsJournalism.com, September 22, 2009 * Until 2005, Visa was the exclusive sponsor of the [[Triple Crown of Thoroughbred Racing|Triple Crown]] thoroughbred tournament. * Visa sponsored the [[Rugby World Cup]] first from the [[1995 Rugby World Cup]] was held in South Africa until 12 years later, when the [[2007 Rugby World Cup]], was held in France.[http://www.brandrepublic.com/news/803120/Visa-terminates-global-Rugby-World-Cup-sponsorship/?DCMP=ILC-SEARCH Visa terminates global Rugby World Cup sponsorship], Brand Republic, April 17, 2008 * In 2007, Visa became the sponsor of the [[2010 FIFA World Cup]] in South Africa. The FIFA partnership provides Visa with global rights to a broad range of FIFA activities – including both the 2010 and 2014 FIFA World Cup and the FIFA Women's World Cup. * Starting from the [[2012 Formula One season|2012 season]], Visa became a partner of the [[Caterham F1 Team]]. Visa is also known for motorsport sponsorship in the past: it sponsored [[PacWest Racing]]'s IndyCar team in [[1995 IndyCar season|1995]] and [[1996 IndyCar season|1996]], with drivers [[Danny Sullivan]] and [[Mark Blundell]] respectively.{{cite web|url=http://www.caterhamf1.com/partners/visa|title=''caterhamf1.com''|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121014084736/http://caterhamf1.com/partners/visa|archive-date=October 14, 2012|df=mdy-all}} * Visa is currently a jersey sponsor of professional gaming ([[esports]]) team [[SK Gaming]] for 2017{{cite web|url=https://www.tsn.ca/sk-gaming-announces-partnership-with-visa-1.645227|title=SK Gaming announces partnership with VISA – Article – TSN|date=January 6, 2017}} * Visa is the main sponsor of the [[Argentine Hockey Confederation]].{{cite web |title=Confederación Argentina de Hockey Homepage |url=https://www.cahockey.org.ar/ |website=Confederación Argentina de Hockey |access-date=22 September
